name: Ranger
description:
A master marksman and an experienced wayfarer, the Ranger is at home in the wilds, combining martial prowess with stealth and proficiency in Green magic. The Ranger is the class that best knows the wilderness - forests and plains, jungles and hills.  He or she is familiar with the terrain, creatures and conditions found therein.

Role: The Ranger is a skilled ranged fighter, adept at ambushes and against large groups. His or her skills on the trail can be especially useful to the party in wilderness areas.

name: Troubadour
description:
The Troubadour is a travelling minstrel, itinerant performer of ballads and folk songs and a worker of minor magicks.  Never in one place for long, he or she has thrown in with your party to see where the road takes you.

Role: The Troubadour is a jack of all trades. Whether spells or blades or theft or negotiation be the order of the day, this cheeky minstrel has something up his or her sleeve.

name: Exorcist
description:
Wielding blade, cross and faith, the Exorcist has dedicated his or her life to defeating demonic and undead foes. A life of tracking infernal creatures through inhospitable territory has taught the Exorcist the value of stealth, and when driven to fight he or she can call on both cold steel and protective White magic.

Role: The Exorcist can play a number of roles. He or she is handy at both melee and ranged combat and wields useful White magic spellcasting powers. The Exorcists class abilities provide specific offensive and defensive options against demons, undead and illusions.

name: Sorcerer
description:
A master of the arcane arts and a member of the exclusive inner cabal of Sorcery. The destructive magical powers at the disposal of a Sorcerer are unequalled by any other class. The Sorcerer is a learned man possessing a broad knowledge of subjects from astronomy to zoology.  He is also perhaps the class most knowledgeable about the Maze itself, as his brotherhood has studied the subject extensively.

Role: Master of the destructive school of Red magic, the Sorcerer can deploy a great variety of strong offensive magic. He or she will need support and protection from other characters to employ it to best effect.

name: Shaman
description:
Born in a primitive society with a rare gift, the Shaman is a medium to the spirit world, and able to channel the elemental powers of fire, water, earth and air.  Although normally guaranteed a cushy job as tribal witchdoctor, an unfortunate abundance of talented individuals in his or her generation forced the Shaman to strike out alone.

Role: The Shaman is a versatile character able to fight in the front line or play support role with extended or ranged weapons. Although more lightly armoured than other melee characters, the Shaman's command of Blue magic give him or her strong attacking options.

name: Blackguard
description:
The Blackguard is the quintessential anti hero, a black knight with a reputation for evil and chaos. Their black hearts revel only in slaughter and strife. Heavily armed and armoured, the Blackguard strides dauntlessly into battle, bloodied weapon at the ready, a deadly and feared veteran of many battlefields.

Role: The Blackguard is a vicious frontline melee fighter. Black magic spell use and reasonable ranged combat options make him or her versatile in combat. The Blackguard has little time for playing nice with peaceful NPCs, and works best in a party committed to bloodshed.

name: Burglar
description:
Dishonest and unscrupulous, maybe. But a Burglar will open chests and doors for you, and hold his or her own in combat. Burglars are drawn from many different urban backgrounds: from the pennyless street urchin to the unsavoury thief. The only real requirements are a willingness to break the law and the ability not to get caught doing it. 

Role: The Burglar's interest is loot, and he or she is expert at finding and appraising it, and at bypassing the various obstacles typically surrounding it. Although competent in combat situations, a Burglar will need help from stronger fighters and magic users to survive real battle.

name: Elemental
description:
Born with a touch of dragon blood in his or her veins, the Elemental possesses an uncanny affinity for the elements and strong wild magical talent.  Although untrained and occasionally unpredictable, the Elementals powers are a benefit to any party.

Role: As the strongest Blue magic user, Elementals have almost unmatched powers of magical destruction and conjuration at their command. With limited other options, they'll need some help when destroying stuff isn't an appropriate course of action.

name: Warlock
description:
The Warlock is an experienced all round adventurer.  Brimming with self taught natural magical talent, a trained warrior, and adept at stealth and skullduggery too, he is a useful party member whether spells or swords are the order of the day.

Role: The Warlock is a dangerous combat opponent, able to employ Red magic and deadly and unique class abilities to take down targetted foes. He operates best when other tougher characters are taking the hits and making room for his damaging combos.

name: Druid
description:
A member of an ancient nature worhipping cult, Druids pass through the wilds at peace with the plants and animals around them. 

Role: Although weak in combat the Druid is skilled magic user. The strongest Green magic caster can deploy both the protections and wrath of nature. Druids have some skills at avoiding combat, but like all specialist casters usually need protection in melee.

name: Sohei
description:
The Sohei is a warrior-monk and a mystic, trained in both the magical and martial arts in a remote mountain monastery.  His or her peace with nature provides aptitiude with Green magic, and combined with a proficiency with a wide range of conventional arms makes the Sohei a versatile addition to any group.

Role: The Sohei is a tough defensive fighter, able to deflect and resist many attacks and especially adept with swords and spears. Minor Green magic offers a variety of non-combat options.

name: Ninja
description:
Lurking in darkness and striking without warning, the Ninja combines stealth and a sharp blade with the curses and blights of Black magic. The Ninja knows the business of killing like no other class, and associated disciplines like poison, anatomy and disguise.

Role: Although not the strongest melee fighter, the Ninja excels at delivering deadly strikes while other party members distract opponents. Limited Black magic ability can provide a threat when stealth and a knife in the back have failed.

name: Acolyte
description:
A dedicated worshipper of a some sinister dark god, the Acolyte is a highly skilled practitioner of Black magic.  Although frail of body and prone to unsettling, secretive and anti-social behaviour, there is no questioning his or her usefulness in a magical battle.

Role: The Acolyte is a strong offensive magic user able to blight and curse foes. He or she is weak in melee combat and needs protection by stronger characters.

name: Enchanter
description:
Enchantment and illusion are the Enchanter's areas of expertise.  Some are unscrupulous hucksters and charlatans, some are professional entertainers, others are earnest students of the mysterious Fey.

Role: The Enchanter's unmatched command of Gold magic give him or her a wide variety of options to confuse, evade or weaken foes and heal or protect allies. Somewhat lacking raw hitting power, they rely on other party members for protection in melee.

name: Courtesan
description:
The Courtesan is a political animal - a graceful and educated lady raised in the courts of the First Realm. Adept at negotiating complex social situations, the Courtesan also has a variety of magical and mundane tricks up her sleave.

Role: The Courtesan has the most extensive abilities dealing with NPCs of any class. Minor Purple magic ability makes her a versatile support magic user with both combat and non-combat options. While she has a few tricks to survive in combat, she will need backup from heavier troops when things come to blows.

name: Paladin
description:
The honorable and fearless peer of a knightly order, the Paladin can both lead the party into battle and heal the subsequent wounds. The Paladin is a trained leader with a knowledge of military tactics and strategy.  He or she is also skilled in etiquette and diplomacy and educated in chivalry and heraldry.

Role: The Paladin is a natural party leader. He or she is able to be a front line fighter, a useful healer, and the face of the party in social situations. A strict code of honour means Paladins work best in a party committed to valour, honesty and fair dealings.

name: Monk
description:
The ascetic follower of a monastic order, the Monk is sworn to a life of chastity and poverty.  He or she lacks any magical skill but compensates by being a skilled and tenacious fighter. The Monks uncanny sixth sense and powers of ESP are useful if somewhat unpredictable.

Role: An unmatched martial arts warrior, the Monk can mix it up in melee with the best of them. His or her exotic training and spiritual discipline gives him or her a variety of abilities, resistances and immunities that appear almost supernatural to the uninitiated.

name: Witch
description:
Born the seventh daughter of a seventh daughter, magic is the Witches birthright.  Her powers of beguilement, enchantment and illusion are unmatched. The Witch has a store of wisdom on a wide range of subjects like astrology, herb lore, mythology, curses and the occult.  She is also the class most familiar with the ways of the faerie folk.

Role: As the strongest Purple magic user, the Witch is a potent specialist caster with both offensive and defensive options. She has special synergies with other Purple magic casters in the party. Like other specialist casters, the Witch will need protection from tougher characters to best deploy her magic.

name: Gadgeteer
description:
Scorning the vagaries of magic, the Gadgeteer is a master of engineering and technology. His or her skill at combining trinkets and components into potent gadgets is unmatched. Whether powered by clockwork springs, steam, electricity or compressed air, the Gadgeteer is adept at harnessing the raw power of physics to his or her advantage.

Role: The Gadgeteer is a skilled ranged fighter, whose chosen ranged weapon is upgraded as he or she advances. Engineering skill provides the ability to construct useful gadgets, making up for his or her lack of magical ability.

name: Skald
description:
A performer and a weaver of enchantment. The Skald is also a doughty fighter, able to lead the party into battle or lend support from the rear. The Skald's knowledge of legend, mythology and history is unsurpassed. He or she has inherited a long oral tradition from a mentor that may contain all manner of other wisdom.

Role: The Skald is a warrior poet, wielding both blades and magic in the front line of the party. Able to use a good selection of arms and armour, he or she can also make a useful backup healer with minor Gold magic talent.

ability.spell: Song of the Warriors of Valhalla

name: Berserker
description:
The Berserker's blessing and curse are the same - in the heat of battle the blood madness will come upon him or her, driving superhuman feats of strength and endurance. Sure there's a time and place for sniping and trading spells, but when things get down to an ugly brawl at tooth and claw range the Berserker is who you want in the mix.
 
Role: The Berserker is a tough frontline fighter able to soak up damage and take down the largest foes. Without access to magic and with limited ranged combat options the Berserker needs help in situations where cracking heads isn't an effective option.

name: Priest
description:
Blessed of the gods, the Priest wields strong protective and healing magic for the benefit of his or her party. The Priest has an education that includes theology, anatomy and medical principals.  He or she is the class that best knows the ways of the myriad gods and powers that influence the lives of those within the Maze.

Role: The Priest has the strongest healing and White magic powers. Not especially interested in combat, he or she will need help with violent situations. A strict code of ethics means Priests work best in a party committed to honesty and fair dealings.

name: Samurai
description:
In his home country, the Samurai was a member of the ruling military aristocracy. In the wilds of the Maze, he is a fearless warrior who combines a peerless mastery of swordplay with fierce sorcerous magic. The Samurai is an educated and literate man, with a broad background ranging from the arts to military strategy.

Role: A master of swordplay, the Samurai finds a place the the front row of the party. Not as heavily armoured as other combatants, he or she must rely on the ability to dispatch foes quickly and efficiently. A handful of Red magic spells and some archery skill give the Samurai good offensive options.

name: Shugenja
description:
The Shugenja is an ascetic hermit who has spent much of his or her life in a remote retreat. Adept at obfuscation and a talented magic user, the Shugenja makes a versatile if enigmatic party member. He or she has a reputation for mystical wisdom and insights, and prefers delivering this knowledge to party members as riddles and ominous pronouncements.

Role: The Shugenja is a tricky customer, sporting a variety of stealthy ways to confuse the thwart enemies. Handy combat tricks and a smattering of offensive Blue magic mean that he or she can play a variety of roles in the party.

name: Hero
description:
Dashing, charismatic and a natural leader.  The Hero leads the party from the front and is a master of melee combat. Although not the most intellectual of classes, the Hero does know about dungeons and loot.  He or she is knowlegeable about the habits and capabilties of such fantastic beasts as are often in need of slaying and is a cunning one-on-one fighter experienced in evaluating foes.

Role: Heroes belong in the front line, taking the hits and dealing out damage. With no special ranged abilities and no magical talent, he or she will need companions to step up in these other, less heroic situations.

name: Amazon
description:
Raised by a fanatical sect of warrior women, the Amazon is a dauntless soldier versed in the ways of Purple magic. The Amazons primary interest is warfare and soldiering. She is also is at home in the wilderness, trained in tracking, survival and ambuscade. 

Role: The Amazon is a versatile melee and ranged fighter. Her class abilities give her resilience against many debuffs and her access to the versatile Witchcraft school of magic give her a some non-weaponised options.
